description:
Bayesian techniques present a compelling alternative to the frequentist
view of statistics, providing a flexible approach to extracting a swathe
of meaningful information from your data. The learning curve is somewhat
steep, but the benefits of adding Bayesian techniques to your tool suite
are enormous!

What are the bare essentials that you need to know to start applying
Bayesian techniques? This talk will provide an entry level discussion
covering the following topics:

-  What can Bayes do for me? (A brief introduction to Bayesian methods)
-  Understanding Markov Chain Monte Carlo. (MCMC is what happens behind
   the scenes)
-  What is Stan? (Writing models in Stan)
-  Using Stan in Python. (The PyStan package)

The talk will be peppered with useful tips for dealing with the initial
challenges of using Stan with Python.
title: Bayesian Analysis in Python: A Starter Kit
